newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turk graft commission to rule on Ciller charges.
newsitem.headline: Turk graft commission to rule on Ciller charges.

text.p: A parliamentary commission began meeting on Monday to rule on sending Turkey's deputy prime minister, Tansu Ciller, to the Supreme Court on graft charges stemming from her recent spell as head of the government.

Parliamentary soures said a decision was expected later in the day on whether to ask parliament to send Ciller to the highest court in the land for allegedly failing to prevent contract irregularities at a state-run electricity company.
The government has a majority of one MP in the 15-member commission. The allegation is the least serious of three corruption charges against Ciller, now foreign minister.

She headed three governments from 1993 until earlier this year. Ciller now serves in coalition with Islamist Prime Minister Necmettin Erbakan whose Welfare Party had previously backed the allegations.
